title: Drawing, "Design for a Lamp Base in Aluminum", September 30, 1931
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamps: Large stamp in black ink at lower right: Donald Deskey/145 West 57th Street/New York City See Inscription Architect's stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY; see inscription
inscribed: Inscribed dimensions, instructions, materials Inscribed in black ink and graphite in stamp: Stock 328 / Materials (crossed out)SATIN FINISH / (crossed out)BRONZE POL. / ALUMINUM Drawn by R.S. / Approved by D.D. / Date SEPT 30/31 / Revised 11/20/31 Drawing/930312 / Scale 1 1/2" = 1"0"/ Record of Prints, Date 1/12, No 1, Sent To GNPT. Inscribed in graphite with dimensions, instructions, materials throughout Architect's stamp inscribed in graphite: 930312; 1 1/2"=1'0; 328 / SATIN (crossed out) FINISH / BRONZE (crossed out) POL. / ALUMINUM; R.S. / D. D. /SEPT 30/31 / 11/20/31; 1/12 1 GNPT
description: Design for lamp stem and base; the stem resembles an extruded eye-beam set on a stepped based. The drawing has three images of the base. The stamp of the Deskey office in in the lower right. Scale is noted throughout the drawing.  Scale: 1 1/2"=1'
